jparsec.ephem.moons

Class MoonPhysicalParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.moons.MoonPhysicalParameters

  • public class MoonPhysicalParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to obtain the orientation and physical ephemeris of a satellite, based on IAU 2000/2006/2009 recomendations. The different implementations are used for the different values of the ephem method to apply in the ephemeris object. The default method (for values different from IAU 2006 and IAU 2009) is the IAU 2000 recommendations for the orientations of the satellite axes.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    MoonEphem

    • Method Detail

      • physicalParameters

        public static MoonEphemElement physicalParameters(double JD,
                                  EphemElement ephem_sun,
                                  MoonEphemElement ephem_obj,
                                  ObserverElement obs,
                                  EphemerisElement eph)
                                           throws JPARSECException
        Obtain physical parameters of the satellite: angular radius, visual magnitude, and axis orientation. Any satellite with known information (see IAU2009 report by B. A. Archinal et al.) is supported. No supported objects will have zero in the corresponding fields.
        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in dynamical time.
        ephem_sun - Ephem object with ephemeris of sun.
        ephem_obj - Moon ephem object to take and store data.
        obs - The observer object.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        Moon ephem with the completed data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the object data cannot be found.

      • calcAxis

        public static MoonEphemElement calcAxis(double JD,
                        EphemElement ephem_sun,
                        MoonEphemElement ephem_obj,
                        double lon0,
                        double rot_per_day,
                        EphemerisElement eph,
                        Target.TARGET motherBody)
                                 throws JPARSECException
        Calculate orientation of a satellite providing the position and the direction of the north pole of rotation. The IAU 2000/2006/2009 models are used depending on the properties of the ephemeris element object. See the REPORT OF THE IAU/IAG WORKING GROUP ON CARTOGRAPHIC COORDINATES AND ROTATIONAL ELEMENTS: 2009, B. A. Archinal et al, in Celestial Mechanics and Dynamical Astronomy, 2011.

        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        ephem_sun - Ephem object with all data for the sun.
        ephem_obj - Moon ephem object with all data completed except those fields related to the disk orientation (equinox of date).
        lon0 - Initial longitude of satellite at JD = 2451545.0.
        rot_per_day - Rotation speed in degrees/day.
        eph - Ephemeris object defining the ephemeris properties.
        motherBody - The mother body for the calculations. Can be set to null for the Earth.
        Returns:
        Moon ephem object with all the fields.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getBodyMeanRotationRate

        public static double getBodyMeanRotationRate(EphemerisElement eph)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the mean rotation rate of a given body using the corresponding IAU model.
        Parameters:
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body and ephemeris method.
        Returns:
        The rotation rate in radians/second.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getBodySiderealTimeAt0Lon

        public static double getBodySiderealTimeAt0Lon(double JD_TDB,
                               EphemerisElement eph)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the mean rotation rate of a given body using the corresponding IAU model.
        Parameters:
        JD_TDB - Julian day in TDB.
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body and ephemeris method.
        Returns:
        Apparent sidereal time in radians for an observer at longitude 0.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getBodyNorthPole

        public static LocationElement getBodyNorthPole(double JD_TDB,
                               EphemerisElement eph)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the orientation of the north pole of rotation of a given body using the corresponding IAU model.
        Parameters:
        JD_TDB - Julian day in TDB.
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body, ephemeris method, and output equinox.
        Returns:
        North pole direction.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getBodyAbsoluteMagnitude

        public static double getBodyAbsoluteMagnitude(EphemerisElement eph)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns the absolute magnitude of a given natural satellite.
        Parameters:
        eph - Ephemeris object containing target body.
        Returns:
        Absolute magnitude, or EphemElement.INVALID_MAGNITUDE in case it cannot be computed for the given body.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
